text:
March 2, 1967
Mr. Jack Gould
Radio-Television Editor
The New York Times
229 West 43rd Street
New York, New York 10036
Dear Mr. Gould:
Just a brief note of appreciation for your most
preceptive article on educational radio in last
Sunday’s New York Times. From the reaction already
received, I think I can safely say that, thanks to
your most sensitive and thoroughgoing skills, you
"hit the nail right on the head.”
We will certainly continue to keep you informed of
legislative and related developments as they unfold
in the coming weeks and months. In the meantime,
please feel free to contact this office, if you
should desire any additional background information.
I know I speak for everyone championing the cause of
educational radio as a national resource by expressing
our thanks and admiration for the superb job.
Sincerely,
Jerrold Sandler
